storyInfo: A perplexed Siege fails to get Cador's approval, and the rift between the Glasgow Gang members new and old grows even deeper. Rhodes Island tries to use the hotel's communication station.

attributes.content: Sixty percent of the Infected here were infected within the week. They're deteriorating fairly rapidly too.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Almost everyone here seems to have been abusing their Originium Arts. They haven't had time to learn what being an Infected feels like, or how to live as one.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If only Shining was here... no, even a typical Rhodes Island Medic Operator would be doing a far better job than I am now.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: All I can do is... not enough.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Don't blame yourself, Amiya. You've been at this the whole time.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: There weren't as many Infected in the streets of Norport before. It's true that everyone here fights tooth and nail just to get by, but we are in Londinium after all.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It was only after I had left that I gradually came to realize just how lucky I was. What I took for granted was just exceptions for my privilege.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: People misjudge their own abilities in the environments they inhabit, mistakenly believing they rightfully earned their positions in life through their own efforts.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Only when everything crumbles does one recognize the silver spoon in one's mouth.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Hah. Such self-awareness, Your Royal Highness.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: So, this is what you came back for? To grow a large base of loyalists to help you ascend to the throne?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Heh, I'm the stupid one here. I actually thought... you were the legendary 'Siege' they would willingly die for.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: It was not my intention, Cador.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I've never claimed to be any kind of royalty, but... that move Morgan pulled did prove useful.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You talked of 'unity' before, so regardless, this is just a—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Wow, such an honor, to earn praise from Her Royal Highness Vina!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: How touching! Should we shake hands and find your royal photographer to take a picture of us together?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I don't know how I've offended you, Cador, but I believe we should be on the same side.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The same side?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Look, you're all clean and innocent... but us?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Just the other day, we kicked out an old couple.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: They were my neighbors at the apartment I was renting, and they used to be real nice to me, even giving me fried fins they had made too much of.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: When we were dragged out by the Sarkaz and brought to this area, I saw them panicking in the crowd, practically drowning in it, trying their hardest to not let go...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I couldn't take it anymore, and I brought them to the boxing gym.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: That old lady worked really hard, and helped us out a ton. The old man... well, he told a good joke, at least, and a night watch with him around was never boring.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But I had them leave a few days ago.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Delphine gave them two days' worth of rations, and helped them settle down at the Sude Shopping Center's basement car park.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: That place must have already been looted a dozen times, but if you're lucky, you can sometimes find food that's been left behind.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: That's a solid shelter, it should be safe enough.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But they were Infected. Turned not too long ago at that. I don't know where the Originium dust even floated from, and they're old, and their condition was worsening rapidly.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And I...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I didn't give them a single Oripathy inhibitor. Because they should go to someone younger and stronger who needs it more.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I understand your decision. But...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I know. They're ancient. They would probably die from a Sarkaz's Arts, or from a building collapsing in on them, or even from a heart attack triggered by a cannon blast—but I snatched their last shred of hope away from them.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: They might have even survived—but I killed them.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And I don't think I've done any wrong.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You know what, Vina? Can you imagine how they were when they left?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I can imagine...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No. You can't.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: No crying, no pleading, no cursing. That old man was still making jokes up to the very last moment, mocking the head chef of the old Gaulish restaurant at the mall.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: They clutched their tiny little bag, stuffed with all their remaining hopes. And just like that, they helped each other up through all their shaking and trembling and went out the door.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: If they were unlucky, they might've already been robbed by some roadside lunatic.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I dreamt of them yesterday.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You're not responsible for any of this, Cador, you're just—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You think I dreamt of their tragic deaths? From Oripathy, starvation, or the flames of war? Heh.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I... I dreamt that the war was over, that Norport had returned to Londinium, and we were rebuilding our home.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I saw order being restored, the city walls patched up, us living in spanking new houses. And then amongst a crowd celebrating it all, I saw... that old geezer.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Still alive. He had survived, and sometimes it was his wife instead. He or she would stare at me dead-on with those eyes, in the gaps between the fireworks.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I was never afraid of them dying. I know I made a cruel decision, I forced them to sacrifice themselves for a chance to save some others.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But what if, when all of this is done and over with, hatred still flows on the peaceful banks of the St. Djuna River? He'll gaze at me, as if asking me—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: How should I answer? How do I leave this war?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'm very s—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Don't apologize, Vina! You don't have the right.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You hold a sword that only exists in fables, and tell us the former boss of the Glasgow Gang is actually a king, and those young thugs following her are knights, supporters and vassals of royalty—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: —And then you say, that you've returned, you should help us, you can save us, and we should unite and stand together by your side.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Real funny, innit? After all everyone's been through—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: After the Glasgow Gang, who helped others run their turf become a ragtag group of drifters, thieves, robbers, and murderers, you've finally returned.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You became kings, knights, and saints.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I should be welcoming you with open arms, 'King of the Siege.'
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Your Glasgow Gang isn't here anymore. You are nothing. To us members of the current Glasgow Gang, you are nothing at all.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But we have to work together!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Only then we can stop—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...survive the war.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You sure are clever. Vina, we don't plan to stop anything, and you have no good reason for us to sacrifice ourselves for your lofty ideals.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You lot, and the nobles, are at war with the Sarkaz, fighting over something I could have never thought about my whole life.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And us utterly defenseless commoners, we're pushed here by just the slightest ripples of your war.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Yes, for the sake of keeping my head. I will first resist the urge to strangle you to death.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You lot can stay here, and go on with your magnificent plans to save this neighborhood or the whole damned country.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Or you can finish your business, and then leave quietly, just as you arrived.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I have no thoughts on any of this, 'Your Royal Highness,' am I even qualified to ask?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm only a member of the Glasgow Gang, and the Vina you know.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Then we wait and see, Vina.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Phew......
attributes.name: Elderly Sarkaz

attributes.content: I told you before, Mr. Colbert. Loading up supplies and throwing them out was not a good idea.
It is indeed different from what I had imagined, Percival.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I thought... this would somehow help a few people.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: They could have each swiped one of two can of beans, and they could make it last until the next distribution.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I should have made this even more public—
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: It would have ended the same, Mr. Colbert, or maybe even worse.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Even if they were pretending to be polite before, you should probably hide somewhere safe with the way things are now.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: It's good that you have some life-saving supplies, but take a guess. Would you look more like a saint or a devil in their eyes?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Haha, I am a Sarkaz, in the first place.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Are they telling the truth?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: An Aslan heir to the throne? The dukes are following her orders and are about to launch an assault here?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Hmph, I'm sure you're not one of those street punks who believe in those legends, we all know how the king died.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Whoever they are, they've helped us greatly, so we should...
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Talk with them, right?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Miss Ines! We should gone about this in a gentler...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're the one from before...
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Believe us, we mean no harm.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.options: We just want to talk to you.

attributes.content: Do you think I'd believe you? A hooded mystery, a Sarkaz mercenary, and your claim of being in cahoots with the Aslan King?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Hmph, anything is possible.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I never expected I'd get another identity for myself here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What are you planning?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: You're both from the Sunset Street hotel, right?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Seems like these two know their secret channels well.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: A kindly Sarkaz mercenary gave us some supplies, it's not much, but I think...
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Let's not be hasty, sir. We can talk this out.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.options: We also have some attractive proposals for the both of you.

attributes.content: Fine, it doesn't matter who you are, as long as you're serious about helping out Berties.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: So this hotel is still standing... I thought it was a complete ruin from the outside.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I could spend five hours complaining to you about how difficult it was to put up a facade of ruin.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: We just want to avoid trouble, Mr. Colbert here isn't the fighting sort.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I hope you won't blame me, but I just want to... maintain the dignity of this hotel.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: It used to be a great place, and I've worked here my whole life, so I couldn't bear to see my hard work burn to ash.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I understand, Mr. Colbert, I remember what it used to look like.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Those dazzling crystal chandeliers, passionate doormen and waiters, and those gorgeous suites.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Not to mention those beautiful flags hanging on the door.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Flags... I see, you were once a valued guest of our establishment.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: That was many years ago.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We can talk about these things later. I hear there's a Sarkaz mercenary giving you food?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Yes, a young girl who calls herself Paprika. I have a feeling it's not an easy matter for her.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Paprika?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.options: Do you know a mercenary by that name, Ines?

attributes.content: I saw a brief from Ascalon's mission in Highbury, and the name came up.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.options: I remember now, she let Catherine go.

attributes.content: Manfred apprehended her, and I thought she was already dead.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So you're saying this is a genuinely kind Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No, this means that the food supply is probably within the scope of Manfred's plans.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Military Commission needs the people of Norport to stay alive, for now at least.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What are they waiting for?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We don't have the time to care about Sarkaz plans now, Rhodes Islanders.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I know this hotel houses a communications station, and I need to use it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What are you planning to do?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Contact the dukes, and have them provide backup.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So, your story about that 'Her Royal Highness' was fake after all.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: You gave the people of Norport a phony promise.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: We're working hard to make it a reality!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: As long as we get a broadcast out, the dukes won't sit idly by. This I can assure you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You believe in those nobles that much?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I just believe in their ambition.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And what about after your broadcast? There's no way to encrypt the frequency here, so the Sarkaz are going to hear it too.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Miss Vina told me that she and the Glasgow Gang will organize an operation to break through the blockade walls, and should they manage it, there should be secret passages leading outside.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They've used it before.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So we just have to hold out until the dukes launch their assault.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And how long will we need to 'hold out?'
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Under four hours.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You sound certain.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: And after leaving this area? This is a battlefield, after all.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: That's a problem for later. There's no way we can plan for everything in advance.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We just have to escape this place, and then what happens after will surely...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Just a second, are there any other guests in the hotel?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ah? No, of course not.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: It's just me and Percival hiding here these days.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: The shadow is... expanding?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hide yourself and follow me.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Huh? But—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Miss Ines, don't drag me!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Come with me if you want to live, Delphine Windermere!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Wha?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You... how did you...?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.options: You'll want to leave here too.

attributes.content: What? What's going on now?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Mr. Colbert, do as they say.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, you...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.options: Leave it to me.;......;Don't worry, we're still cooperating with him.
You should have a good chat with Miss Delphine.
This is concerning Rhodes Island's future.

attributes.content: ...I get it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No need. I prefer to stand.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've gotten me into quite a bit of trouble, Doctor of Rhodes Island. The identity of Her Royal Highness Alexandrina is an extremely sensitive matter in Victoria, and you should have been well aware of this.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I had thought we already came to a tacit understanding on this matter.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But, well, let us put that aside for the moment...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Might you introduce me to that hasty blue-haired lady who just left? I would like to make her acquaintance.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Perhaps even share a dance with her.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'
